user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ModuleLoad_Static:
```c
int32 OS_ModuleLoad_Static(const char *ModuleName)
{
    int32                      return_code = OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND;
    OS_static_symbol_record_t *StaticSym   = OS_STATIC_SYMTABLE_SOURCE;

    while (StaticSym != NULL)
    {
        if (StaticSym->Name == NULL)
        {
            /* end of list  */
            break;
        }
        if (StaticSym->Module != NULL && strcmp(StaticSym->Module, ModuleName) == 0)
        {
            /* found matching module name */
            return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
            break;
        }

        ++StaticSym;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_ModuleLoad_Static:
typedef const struct
{
    const char *Name;
    void (*Address)(void);
    const char *Module;
} OS_static_symbol_record_t
...
#define OS_STATIC_SYMTABLE_SOURCE OS_STATIC_SYMBOL_TABLE
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
OS_static_symbol_record_t *StaticSym   = OS_STATIC_SYMTABLE_SOURCE;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in this code: the typedef is "typedef const struct { ... } OS_static_symbol_record_t", so OS_static_symbol_record_t already denotes a const-qualified struct type. The declaration OS_static_symbol_record_t *StaticSym therefore declares a pointer to a const-qualified type (equivalent to const struct ... *). If the typedef had not included the top-level const (i.e. typedef struct { ... } OS_static_symbol_record_t), then OS_static_symbol_record_t *StaticSym would point to a non-const type and would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
